docblock.description: Creates another dacura server that is dependant on this server
docblock.long-description: This is the mechanism that allows servers to overcome their isolation from one another. When a dacura server wants to access the capabilities of another server, it calls this function and can then use the methods of that service. The dependant server shares the same service context object, the service and the server will be of different types. I don't think this causes a problem anywhere, but it might :)

tag.name: param
tag.description: the id of the secondary server to load

docblock.description: Creates another dacura service that is dependant on the current service
docblock.long-description: This is the mechanism that allows servers to create service objects on top of the one that invoked them. When a dacura server wants to access the capabilities of another service, it calls this function and can then use the methods of that service.

tag.name: param
tag.description: the id of the service to load

Every Dacura Service has an associated Server which serves as an interface between the service and the rest of the system. By convention, the server name is the service name followed by "DacuraServer"
At this stage we also load all of the configuration information in the system and local collections.

docblock.description: Creates another dacura server that is dependant on this server
docblock.long-description: This is the mechanism that allows servers to overcome their isolation from one another. When a dacura server wants to access the capabilities of another server, it calls this function and can then use the methods of that service. The dependant server shares the same service context object, the service and the server will be of different types. I don't think this causes a problem anywhere, but it might :)

tag.name: param
tag.description: the id of the secondary server to load

docblock.description: Creates another dacura service that is dependant on the current service
docblock.long-description: This is the mechanism that allows servers to create service objects on top of the one that invoked them. When a dacura server wants to access the capabilities of another service, it calls this function and can then use the methods of that service.

docblock.description: Creates another dacura server that is dependant on this server
docblock.long-description: This is the mechanism that allows servers to overcome their isolation from one another. When a dacura server wants to access the capabilities of another server, it calls this function and can then use the methods of that service. The dependant server shares the same service context object, the service and the server will be of different types. I don't think this causes a problem anywhere, but it might :)

tag.name: param
tag.description: the id of the secondary server to load

docblock.description: Creates another dacura service that is dependant on the current service
docblock.long-description: This is the mechanism that allows servers to create service objects on top of the one that invoked them. When a dacura server wants to access the capabilities of another service, it calls this function and can then use the methods of that service.

tag.name: param
tag.description: the id of the service to load

docblock.description: Creates another dacura server that is dependant on this server
docblock.long-description: This is the mechanism that allows servers to overcome their isolation from one another. When a dacura server wants to access the capabilities of another server, it calls this function and can then use the methods of that service. The dependant server shares the same service context object, the service and the server will be of different types. I don't think this causes a problem anywhere, but it might :)

tag.name: param
tag.description: the id of the secondary server to load

docblock.description: Creates another dacura service that is dependant on the current service
docblock.long-description: This is the mechanism that allows servers to create service objects on top of the one that invoked them. When a dacura server wants to access the capabilities of another service, it calls this function and can then use the methods of that service.

tag.name: param
tag.description: the id of the service to load

Every Dacura Service has an associated Server which serves as an interface between the service and the rest of the system. By convention, the server name is the service name followed by "DacuraServer"
At this stage we also load all of the configuration information in the system and local collections.

docblock.description: Creates another dacura server that is dependant on this server
docblock.long-description: This is the mechanism that allows servers to overcome their isolation from one another. When a dacura server wants to access the capabilities of another server, it calls this function and can then use the methods of that service. The dependant server shares the same service context object, the service and the server will be of different types. I don't think this causes a problem anywhere, but it might :)

tag.name: param
tag.description: the id of the secondary server to load

docblock.description: Creates another dacura service that is dependant on the current service
docblock.long-description: This is the mechanism that allows servers to create service objects on top of the one that invoked them. When a dacura server wants to access the capabilities of another service, it calls this function and can then use the methods of that service.

tag.description: the id of the service to load

docblock.description: Creates another dacura server that is dependant on this server
docblock.long-description: This is the mechanism that allows servers to overcome their isolation from one another. When a dacura server wants to access the capabilities of another server, it calls this function and can then use the methods of that service. The dependant server shares the same service context object, the service and the server will be of different types. I don't think this causes a problem anywhere, but it might :)

tag.name: param
tag.description: the id of the secondary server to load

docblock.description: Creates another dacura service that is dependant on the current service
docblock.long-description: This is the mechanism that allows servers to create service objects on top of the one that invoked them. When a dacura server wants to access the capabilities of another service, it calls this function and can then use the methods of that service.

docblock.description: API for login service - supports lost password and registration interface too
docblock.long-description: * Creation Date: 12/01/2015

docblock.description: Login API
docblock.long-description: POST login/ Requires $_POST['login-email'] and $_POST['login-password']

docblock.description: Register API
docblock.long-description: POST login/register Requires $_POST['login-email'] and $_POST['login-password']

docblock.description: Lost Password API
docblock.long-description: POST login/lost Requires $_POST['login-email']

docblock.description: Reset Password API
docblock.long-description:

docblock.description: Creates another dacura server that is dependant on this server
docblock.long-description: This is the mechanism that allows servers to overcome their isolation from one another. When a dacura server wants to access the capabilities of another server, it calls this function and can then use the methods of that service. The dependant server shares the same service context object, the service and the server will be of different types. I don't think this causes a problem anywhere, but it might :)

tag.name: param
tag.description: the id of the secondary server to load

docblock.description: Creates another dacura service that is dependant on the current service
docblock.long-description: This is the mechanism that allows servers to create service objects on top of the one that invoked them. When a dacura server wants to access the capabilities of another service, it calls this function and can then use the methods of that service.

docblock.description: Creates another dacura server that is dependant on this server
docblock.long-description: This is the mechanism that allows servers to overcome their isolation from one another. When a dacura server wants to access the capabilities of another server, it calls this function and can then use the methods of that service. The dependant server shares the same service context object, the service and the server will be of different types. I don't think this causes a problem anywhere, but it might :)

tag.name: param
tag.description: the id of the secondary server to load

docblock.description: Creates another dacura service that is dependant on the current service
docblock.long-description: This is the mechanism that allows servers to create service objects on top of the one that invoked them. When a dacura server wants to access the capabilities of another service, it calls this function and can then use the methods of that service.

tag.name: param
tag.description: the id of the service to load

Every Dacura Service has an associated Server which serves as an interface between the service and the rest of the system. By convention, the server name is the service name followed by "DacuraServer"
At this stage we also load all of the configuration information in the system and local collections.

docblock.description: Parses a list of email addresses, separated by commas and/or whitespaces
docblock.long-description: Classifies the addresses into categories: * unknown - the user is unkown to dacura and will be invited for the first time * pending - the user has not confirmed their account (or responded to a previous invitation, the invite will be reissued * active - the user has an active dacura account * invalid - the address was not a valid email address * inactive - the user is registered on dacura but is no longer active * redundant - the user already has a role that allows them to do what they were invite to do

tag.name: param
tag.description: the string of email addresses that are being invited

tag.name: param
tag.description: the role that will be given to invited users

tag.name: return
tag.description: an array of the users who fall into each category (indexed by category)

tag.description: an array "issued": [emails], "failed": [emails] showing the results of the invitations

docblock.description: Creates another dacura server that is dependant on this server
docblock.long-description: This is the mechanism that allows servers to overcome their isolation from one another. When a dacura server wants to access the capabilities of another server, it calls this function and can then use the methods of that service. The dependant server shares the same service context object, the service and the server will be of different types. I don't think this causes a problem anywhere, but it might :)

tag.name: param
tag.description: the id of the secondary server to load

docblock.description: Creates another dacura service that is dependant on the current service
docblock.long-description: This is the mechanism that allows servers to create service objects on top of the one that invoked them. When a dacura server wants to access the capabilities of another service, it calls this function and can then use the methods of that service.

tag.name: param
